text:
hey everyone I am still in Dubai and in the 
previous episode we checked out yummy Middle

Eastern sweets at the Dubai Mall and had 
an amazing Iraqi meal today we are taking

a road trip to Abu Dhabi so we are on our 
way to Abu Dhabi and our friends over here

have made us some crack which is a sweetened 
milk tea infused with cardamom is it just part

of them is there anything else in it sugar 
sugar most important ingredient is sugar

and I'm about to try it I've heard all about 
that about this team is something to try here

ah it's not too sweet and it's not too milky 
rich it's actually a really nice balance of of

the bitter tannic tea the cardamom and then just 
that subtle milkiness and apparently it's sort

of like a drive-through right like you could go 
to yeah you can go through like a shop and just

sit in your car order the tea that's perfect so 
Abu Dhabi is the capital of the UAE and there

are many many impressive structures here even 
though Dubai is sort of known for that we just

drove past the twin towers that have automatic 
sensors for opening and closing window coverings

they almost look from afar like a cocoon and 
they sends heat if it's hot they close if it's

cool they open how cool is that and we're now 
about to go under the longest tunnel in the UAE

the highlight of our drive was the stunning mosque 
which is the largest in the country and it houses

the largest carpet in the world and the entrance 
of the luth we were directed to park pretty far

away but that is not a problem because there's 
a shuttle to take you to the museum and on the

way there you get to see the Magnificent Louvre 
in its massive entirety my first impression of

this is it's just massive absolutely massive 
like I feel like the word massive doesn't even

do with justice it's so big it looks like a big 
dome a flattish domes really integrate intricate

layers cannot wait to see what it looks like on 
the inside the overall design is minimalistic

and clean but the coolest part of the museum is 
that it's built right on the water needless to

say the exhibits were all fascinating but I was 
super excited to see this famous van Gogh a few

Picasso's and this painting from the mr. bean 
movie does anyone know what I'm talking about

here so the pieces themselves are obviously 
wonderful and impressive but I am equally

impressed by the the structure of the museum 
itself the ceiling the floor the mounting of

each piece there's so much thought put into this 
place so much attention to details so this part

of the museum is my most favorite part it is 
what I believe is the center of the dome it's

kind of outdoors there are no walls you can see 
sort of the wind on my hair it's breathtaking

I cannot describe to you the grandness of this 
place I mean you feel so small and you look up

at this intricate roof it's a layers and layers 
and it's letting out dots of light that's sort of

decorating the floor it's absolutely gorgeous 
and the water is all around us the water is

turquoise it's absolutely beautiful color and 
by the way the water around this area is not

always beautiful in blue some parts are kind of 
murky and brown so this is something to behold

we headed back to Dubai for an authentic Emirati 
meal at a super cool place called El sana this

place really takes you back in time the restaurant 
is designed to reflect traditional Emirati homes

and culture with all sorts of vintage household 
items and even a camel and as always I left all

the food ordering to our local friends I have been 
waiting for this we are at an Emirati restaurant

which is actually not easy to find here and to 
start right away they bring us afraid of day

drizzled with a sesame sauce which looks so 
good and apparently the idea is it's supposed

to cleanse your palates of prep your palate for 
the meal that's about to come so here it is oh

wow the sesame sauce is a little salty they give 
you a plate for the seeds and the saltiness and

the nuttiness of the tahini balances out the 
sweet stickiness up to date and it makes it so

much better wow this is a magical combination all 
right I'm ready for food so the food has arrived

that I'm so excited about this the first dish 
I'm gonna try is something called three it was

described to me as a soggy bread stew but I love 
soggy food so this really appealed to me so it's

a bread called a god beautiful chicken stew on top 
of it I've got them right here check this out so I

got a little piece of chicken drumstick and look 
at this beautiful sort of tomatoey sauce smell of

comfort food the bread melts in your mouth it's 
so flavorful the chicken is super tender mason

tomatoey the second dish is something called much 
Busan this is something people have told me you

have to try it and it's rice cooked with sauce and 
you can choose fish chicken or whatever kind of

meat we've got new beef and it's this beautiful 
yellow rice yellow basmati rice right and this

beef is look house look how that just fell apart 
it's so so tender I can smell all the spices

good that beef is incredibly tender and the 
whatever sauce they use has penetrated all

the way through the rice has a little bit 
of a tang to it so I suspect there's yogurt

it meant that's cooked with the rice and just 
I can smell all the spices some cinnamon for

sure probably pardon up in there but my guess 
is is just a ton of spices now finally vidi

Annie pretty ani is one of those dishes that 
I think exists in so many different cultures

including Thailand we have a version of it but 
this looks very different it's lamb and the rice

is a lot whiter so the Vidya in Thailand the 
rice is completely yellow and there are some

raisins Oh lentils I think maybe lentils 
a fried shallots of the super tender lamb

upon just looking at the much boost in Liberty 
any you might think they're very similar but

the flavor is actually very different the 
Ligurian is more subtle the rice is drier

it's not it's not soaking the sauce in 
there's no tank in the way that the much

was has and this is legit and Marathi food 
my duty here my mission here is done so our

dessert has come it is a doughnut so you can't 
go wrong it's a doughnut come on it's called

GameA and it's got this date syrup drizzled 
on top with some sesame seeds sprinkled on

it it's nice and hot so I'm gonna show you 
what it looks like Oh chewy on the inside

excuse the use of my hand oh it's quite 
yellow and chewy and rather dense all right

think the donut crispy on the outside but the 
inside is not light and airy like an American

Jonah it's dense and chewy and super soft not 
that sweet the sweetness all comes from the

date syrup which is so caramelized flavor the 
yellow color as I clear it comes from saffron

it's a beautiful delicious dessert you can really 
get hurt with those because they're so addictive

and it's quite heavy but what a way to end a 
meal at the end of the meal we were offered

a sprinkle of rosewater to freshen our hands 
which was a very nice touch and next time I'm

here I'm definitely coming when the outside 
is open because that seating looks cool and

that concludes my Dubai trip if you missed 
the previous episodes definitely check them

out the links are in the description below and 
remember you can always come hang out with me

on facebook twitter or instagram thank you so 
much for watching and I will see you next time
